headline: Taco in a Bag
description: This flavorful taco treat is a perfect snack to enjoy while mobile. Picnics and block parties are perfect venues for Taco in a Bag.

video.description: These tacos are so easy to make, and really fun to eat out of the bag.
video.name: Taco in a Bag

name: Taco in a Bag

recipeInstructions.text: Place ground beef in a large skillet. Cook and stir over medium heat until browned. Drain excess oil. Mix in the taco seasoning and prepare according to the directions on the package.

With the bags unopened, gently crush the corn chips. Snip the corners off the bags using scissors and slit open the bags along the side edge. Spoon equal amounts of the beef mixture, lettuce, tomato, Cheddar cheese, salsa and sour cream into the bags on top of the crushed chips. Serve in the bag and eat using a fork.

review.reviewBody: What's not to love! It's simple with minimal mess. And; IT'S TACOS (in a bag)! Lol

Frito Pie...originated in Santa Fe, New Mexico at the old Woolworth 5 and dime.

Love this stuff!
The kids love this recipe. We used Doritos Nacho cheese chips for ours.
I didn't add tomatoes but everyone loved it and yes I will be making it again.
We really enjoyed this. I used a small bag of Cheese Doritos for ours and that really was good. My husband said he'd prefer to pour his out onto a plate instead of eating out of the bag.

The fiancé and his teenaged son loved it. I used bone-in chops and the family-sized can of cream of mushroom soup. The extra gravy it made was great to top the mashed potatoes! Also served with a side of green beans with onion and real bacon cooked in them. My first time making this, but probably not the last. ??
I remember frito pies in the bag. They used to make them like this back when I was in high school. Now, we just make them in a bowl!
I made this as an alternative to tacos for my kids. They loved it, and surprisingly made no mess while eating it.

We made these for great "hot" nachos with chili. Made ahead of time with lettuce, cheese, tomato, onion (As desired). Packed up for everyone to eat when we got to the drive-in movie. We added Sour Cream, Guacamole (As desired) Excellent bring-it-yourself meal.

I've been making this for about 10 years now! I call it "WALKING TACOS" (because you can walk about the party and eat it right out of the bag.) Easy simple and cost friendly. Great for ANY party. Easy for the College student too- next best thing to Ramen but better!

Huge hit with my kids and husband! I usually set out shredded lettuce, tomatoes, salsa, guacamole, shredded cheese, cheese dip, sour cream, pico, regular chips and nacho cheese Doritos and let my young kids make their own. They have so much fun and love the results. I have to admit the nacho cheese Doritos are amazing! This is such an easy and quick meal that the whole family is sure to enjoy! Go ahead and just add it to your favorites!

walking tacos is what we call these. GENIUS concept for a quick easy sure to please ANY kid or adult for easy-peasy "taco" stuffin' with easy toss away. Dismayed at the reviews that give it few stars and suggest containers instead...seriously? the beauty of this "in a bag" is that schools, concession stands, camps, and on the go events make for an warm healthy yummy meal. What's NOT healthy about DRAINED ground beef, fresh tomatoes lettuce etc...the corn chips? then remove half of them if that's a concern...
I love this! It takes me back to my childhood when we used to have this in school.

Made this for a weekend camping trip
Pre-cooked and seasoned the meat, then froze it
Had the Taco's in a Bag on the second night
Was a great quick cold meal after a busy day
I have also made these with Nacho Cheese Doritos and Cool Ranch Doritos!
Plain taco salad, should be in a plain bowl. Making your food harder to get to is pretty silly.
This is amazing can be done camping prep all veggies before you go pre cook the meat then heat up over the fire and voila taco in a bag
Great for the kids! I loved it too. I substituted and used turkey, added some garlic and jalapeno to the fresh salsa I made and it was absolutely delish!
My roommates and I enjoyed this. Some of us used Doritos instead. Plus washed them with down with margaritas. Perfect dinner night.

I dont understand how this constitutes a recipe when really it's a bag of ground beef and chips. I understand how convenient this must be but I'm sure you end up with a mess on your clothing. I can only imagine how nasty it feels when the grease coagulates on the bottom of the bag when it's sitting there for a while.
My wife and daughters love it! Will make again for them, I add a little guacamole for them and use gronud turkey or chicken. Yummy! I wish I liked Mexican food I would have ate one too!
Love this concoction. I normally add beans (red kidney, black or both) and top with catalina dressing. Pleases all the picky eaters in the household.
Very good recipe! I was craving taco in a bag and this sure did the trick
love this simple yummy recipe, it's just a fun meal presentation as well. I think next time I'll do Doritos , and mix in some thousand island dressing though
I have one suggestion. Cut the chip bag down the long side of the chip bag for to allow more convenient access.
Our family favorite with friends at the cottage. We call them "walking tacos" and use Doritos instead which come in a variety of cheese flavours here in Canada. Nacho, zesty, spicy etc
I first had this at the World's Fair in Knoxville, TN thirty yrs ago. Love this recipe!! Thanks.
I made this and I love it. eat it straight from the bag no dishes to wash. I was a happy cook. I loved to worth nacho cheese Doritos.

I made these for my grandkids and they were very surprised, and thrilled there were no dishes. Big hit and very good. We dressed ours up anyway we wanted with all of the favorite toppings. We have also added retried beans, and a couple of times added alittle chili. Very easy and good. Great fun for the children.
In Pa. we call them "walking tacos". We sold them at the concession stand at sporting events. Everybody LOVED them!!! You can. Add what YOU want!
I take these when we tailgate. Always a big hit!!! We end up feeding everyone around us because they love the idea.

These are great! Our sons have made these "walking tacos" at scout camp outs for years. A favorite for the boys to make themselves. They like extra cheese and usually leave off the sour cream when hiking . We have also tried with canned chicken breast (in bag) to travel without refrigeration.

The best thing about these are that you have a built in bowl. Great for kids at the park, hiking, youth activities etc. If you have a problem with the bag make a taco salad. These are great as is for easy no fuss on the go meal. And you don't have to bring plates.
I've always called these "Walking Tacos" and I love making them when I go camping! I make mine with ground turkey instead of beef, and also Doritos instead of Fritos. So yummy!
I feel like it's missing something. I just don't know what. Onions? Instead of Fritos, I used nacho cheese Doritos. Very good.
Used Takis instead for Valentine's Day themed meal! Taste great.
I have made this for years But i suggest using small bags of doritos instead of fritos.
After you dump it onto a plate, it's a taco salad!
This is so unhealthy but it is so good! It is a good cheat night dinner that is easy and tasty.

The local food truck at waterfront park in louisville ky used to have these me and my kids loved em. 

so I tired this recipe and omg YUM! better then the park even because ours was fresh of course!! 

Btw you may have to go to your local gas station to get the right sized bags.

This is a clever recipe - the grandsons enjoy it very much. Our family adds another ingredient: a can of black beans, drained, rinsed, and gently sautéed in olive oil with cilantro, and tad of onion power and garlic powder. We also use the slightly larger ( 4.5 oz) bags of chips. Thank you JHERCIK
GREAT WHEN HANGING WITH THE HOMIES, GOES GREAT WITH BEER!! ENJOY!!!!
I loved this smart idea! I tried modifying it with Doritos rather than Fritos, and it was awesome!
We call them walking tacos. Can also be made using doritos. Great for sports team snack stands.

We make these fo the kids at holiday cookouts. They love them, and so do the adults after they coax a "taste" out of their childs bag!!! For that reason I always have plenty of ingredients on hand. I suggest you do the same. They are always a big hit with both the kids and the adults!!! Really do try them at your next cookout!!
We call these walkin tacos. Instead of Fritos we use whatever type of Doritos you like best, tastes like Locos Tacos from T Bell. Easy way to have a taco party!
Love this recipe! You can also use different kinds of chips, like Doritos and it tastes amazing. It's also somewhat portable, because it's in a bag!!! This recipe is so much fun and kids love it.

Love love love this fun and easy for all ages. Put any thing that you like on taco right into the bag . I had them at a graduation party . The following week served it at my dice club all older women they loved them .
We call it "Walking Taco" in our area. It's a big hit at HS football games.

I first ate a Frito Pie (which is what this was called then) as a little girl in Texas in the early 60s. My mother allowed us to buy this at the town's Youth Center once in a while as a treat. I've served it to my own family on occasion, and because it was so seldom served, it was a treat to them as well. My grandchildren like it now.

This was a fast food served at the World's Fair in Knoxville, TN in 1982. We have served a variation of this for 23 years and love it! Thank you for reminding me of this simple meal that is scrumptious!!!! Picnic to the Smokie Mountains or on the boat for sunset watching, it is perfect with little prep..... Stir fry meat and chop veggies. Buy Fritos and take off! Take a small cooler for cheese sour cream etc..
We have been eating these for years and now my grandkids love it too! We also call them walking tacos. They even serve them at the kids ball games in the concession stand.

This is also a terrific fund raiser. We call them Walking Tacos because you can walk around and eat them. When folks are done they just throw away the plastic fork and bag. Easy peasy. They sell like hotcakes. Pun intended.

This is an excellent recipe for an old standby. Lots of variations. As a school kid in TX went across the street to the Harlequin drive-in & for a quarter got a "Frito Pie". Those had chilli over the Fritos & to this day when I serve chilli I put a Layer of Fritos in the bottom. At the fairs & celebrations up north here there's always a stand selling tacos in a bag. Kids love them.

This recipe is great! I agree that Doritos are better. If you don't eat meat you can substitute with chili beans or ranch style beans and its super good. I love that this recipe is super easy and delicious.
Kids loved it!!!
Great lunch on the go for our cub scouts. Around here everyone calls them walking tacos. Only thing we do differently is omit the salsa (I'll put some type of mild sauce on it instead.) Delicious!
If you think Fritos are good try this with a bag of Doritos!! It's fabulous more flavor, yum.
Made it at last minute the other night. The store did not have any snack size Fritos so just improvised and used zip lock bags. My EXTREMELY picky daughter gave it a 'thumbs up!'
we call these doritos locos, we make them as a snack. japanese peanuts, sour cream, valetina hot sauce, cabbage, avocados, tomatoes, and some add pork rinds (cueritos)
This is better with nacho cheese doritos
Dont need the bag! Just buy the frito scoops and decorate them around the edges of your plate. Delicious!

My family lived this recipe! Even my DD who hates traditional tacos said this was her new favorite dinner. I used cheese flavored Doritos instead of corn chips. This would also make a grata dinner while camping!

5 stars based solely on nostalgia, great memories & convenience.... this "recipe" has been around forever (I think the cro-magnon originally used pterodactyl lol) but seriously ive been making so many variations of walking tacos since I was allowed to use the stove lol. I made a variation last night & dint mind extra clean up since I had the cast iron skillet already dirtied so I crushed up an entire family sized bag of the original Doritos dumped them in the skillet after removing the meat (used ground pork AND
 ground beef, extra yummy) dumped the mixture on top & added all imaginable toppings to that (I love adding black beans, kidney beans, avocado & dirty rice) before slathering the entire thing with an entire jar of salsa con queso lol then I baked it in the oven @ 400 degrees till the exposed chips get browned & crispy. Then I just plop the entire skillet on a folded dish towel in the center of the table & devour it upon paper plates.... makes meeeeeee mouth water everytime lol.... my nephew loved it & called it the magical taco mountain... I mean it hovered a good 3"- 4" above the skillet rim.... no left overs :-( makes me sad I have to wait a cpl weeks for this delicious concoction to hit my table again.... happy eatings everyone :-)

A great idea. I made a large batch for an picnic. Everyone chose between Doritos, Fritos, tortilla chips, and all the side fixings. Brought a bunch of gladware bowls, load them up, throw the lid on and shake. One of the best picnics lunches we have ever had!
I already LOVE Fritos, this just get a lot more bought from my side of things~ :)

I love this recipe for quick lunches. I put taco meat in a thermos to keep in cold and I put the baggies of cold ingredients in the cooler part of the lunch bag to keep them cold. I also use the bigger size chips for a bigger serving and they are a big hit.
This was such a fun idea!! On the nights I work this recipe is PERFECT!!! I did use Doritos instead a fritos and never measured the cheese...lol Loved this idea!!
I iowa we call this a walking taco! Thanks for the recipe

I use this recipe for my daughter's 13th birthday party and follow up with some Smore's and it worked out great! Each kid was handed a bag of Fritos and allowed to pick their choices from the other ingredients available. We supplemented with olives and jalapeno peppers.

Where I come from, these are called, Walking Tacos. I didn't change a thing, except to unfortunately serve them in a bowl this time. Only because the big family size bag of Fritos were on sale and I had to be frugal. ;)
In Montana, we make these with Doritos Chips. Also crush chips then, turn the bag sideways, cut length-wise. And it will be easier to fill, eat & mix. They serve these at Basketball & football games.

I had been living out of state and shortly after I returned I found out that my niece was having emergency surgery. Naturally I offered to keep my 7 year old great-niece for the week or so needed for moms recovery. My concern was that other than meeting once or twice for holidays, the child and I were pretty much strangers. Luckily I remembered this recipe and WE decided to put it together for our first lunch. By the time we were eating out of the bags we were great friends. This recipe will be remembered by both of as not only as very tasty in and of itself, but as a building block to a loving relationship.
We call these "walk-away tacos" we use red Doritos as well they are delicious!!!
Super simple & the kids loved it!

The idea is good but we prefer tortilla chips to Fritos. It's good with seasoned chips, like Doritos but we think it's best with plain tortilla chips. I also used small disposable plastic bowls and plastic forks. I'll make this again.
In Pennsylvania we call these walking tacos. We use Doritos instead of fritos and crunch them up a little. They sell like crazy at sporting events and man are they good.
That's friggen awesome! LOL LOVE IT!
My picky kids loved this!!!

I love this idea! I made it for a football game & it was great because everyone got to have their "taco" the way they like it without all the hassle of assembly- since I seem to always be the designated taco-assembler. I think this would be great for kids too. Clean up is easy & everyone was full & happy.
My guilty pleasure, to be eaten on "sweat pants" days :) I prefer them with frito's scoops and my nephew likes using nacho doritos. It's all good!
Made this using cheddar cheese sauce rather than the shredded cheese. Instead of bags, used plates. It was easy, turned out great and was quite filling.
Made this last weekend while camping with the grandkids-it was a super hit. Very easy and quick clean-up.

Fun! Fun! Fun! I use low sodium taco seasoning because the chips etc. add up to a lot saltiness. Serve with icy cold beverages to quench thirst! So easy to adapt the idea many ways for cost effectivness for church youth group etc. by using cheaper corn chips and paper plates for example but the fun is in using corn chips in a bag and dumping whatever you like in the bag! :)

I like to cut my bags lengthwise, easier to get into it with your fork. And they are so much better with homemade guacamole and ground turkey! Skip the beef and sour cream, the chips have enough calories.

oh boy this is great for the kids no mess tacos which they love to make and love to eat I put the chips out they pick and make them regular tacos are messy and you end up eating them with a fork so why not start that way with no mess just give this recipe a try and let the kids make them they will eat better if they make it I swear by it if they make it they will eat it.

I LOVE TACO IN A BAG !!! Ever since the first time I had it at our local fair :) I've been using ground pork instead of beef lately bc my Gf made tacos for me with ground pork and OMG what a difference. I was getting sick of tacos bc of the ground beef and this changed my mind :D I also use liquid con queso or Mexican fiesta cheese instead of cheddar and that makes it a 10 stars !!!
Super fun idea and it was definitely enjoyed by those who took the option at our taco bar!
Used ground turkey and romaine just for a little more nutrition. Loved them!

This is a great recipe but I changed it to my families liking. Instead of corn chips we use Dorito's or Aribia's. We also do this at different tournaments we are in. The Canteen makes up a big batch and we use personal size Dorito bags and we crush the Doritos and then add the rest of the ingredients. It is great also for when you go camping no dishes.
In Iowa we put them in small Dorito bags and call them Walking Tacos. :) Excellent for concession stands at ball games!

Our Girl Scout troop makes these when we camp. We call them "Walking Tacos" - they are portable and great for camping. My 8 yr old and 10 yr old love them because they can add their own condiments. We also use chopped onion and guacamole. At home I pile this on top of a bowl of spinach or romaine for a taco salad.
Fun twist on a classic.
We call these walking taco's at my house. They are a family favorite, with doritos. We open the bag from the side instead of the top to make them easier to eat.
Love these! First time I had one was at The Craven Country Jamboree In Craven Sask.! Awesome when your hungover! ;-P

I love the concept of these but I find them to be a bit too small for my family-and the cost of the individual bags to be a bit much-I buy a large bag and divide into individual servings in a resuable container-top with the remaining ingredients omitting the sour cream etc till just before serving. WE take these on the road as a tailgate meal when driving to camp-platic utensils and napkins make it a great portable meal. When in camp we do much the same but use plates or bowls to serve. Try subbing ground chicken or turkey for a healthier option.
I fixed this the other night and it was a hit!!! Wouldn't change a thing! My kids loved it!
These are good. AKA-Walking Taco. Use nacho cheese Doritos, instead of corn chips. Makes a huge difference!
This recipe is awesome!! There is a fair in Ohio that I have gone to forever that has almost the same recipe. We use Fritos, kidney beans, and diced onions too.
